Yes, the transportation of the Moai statues by the Rapa Nui people is nothing short of remarkable. The statues are made of solid volcanic rock and weigh anywhere from several tons to over 80 tons each. Despite these enormous weights, the Rapa Nui people managed to move the statues across the island using a system of ropes and rollers.

It is believed that the Rapa Nui people used logs as rollers and several groups of individuals to pull the statue using ropes. They would then use a system of levers and wedges to lift the statue and move it onto its final resting place.

The precise methods used by the Rapa Nui people to move the statues remain a mystery, but their ingenuity and resourcefulness are a testament to their advanced technological capabilities. The transportation of the statues is just one example of the exceptional craftsmanship and engineering skills of the Rapa Nui people.
